title: The Research Lifecycle as a Strategic Roadmap

research_phases.evidence: Section 'The Mastery Cycle': discussion of reading, thinking, writing, and disciplinary knowledge as prerequisites for research.
Section 'The Planning Cycle': literature review, citation management, ethics review, grant discovery, and data management planning.
Section 'The Project Cycle': execution of experiments, observations, data collection, and methodological support.
Section 'The Publication Cycle': writing, editing, peer review, publishing, and intellectual property considerations.
Section 'The Electronic Preservation Cycle': preservation, dissemination, metadata creation, repositories, and data curation.

activities.activity: Conducting literature reviews and managing citations

Planning Cycle: discussion of IRB workflows and ethical oversight.

summary: This paper presents a generic, cross-disciplinary research lifecycle model consisting of mastery, planning, project, publication, and preservation cycles. It details activities, inputs, outputs, tools, and institutional roles at each stage, supported by a lifecycle diagram and comparison with other models. The research lifecycle is positioned as a strategic framework for organizing and evaluating research support services.
